Package no.geosoft.jtimeseries.util

Class XmlUtil

java.lang.Object
no.geosoft.jtimeseries.util.XmlUtil
public final class XmlUtil extends Object
Convenience methods that makes up for the terrible API of the standard JDK XML package.
Author:
Jacob Dreyer

  • Method Details

    • xmlEncode

      public static String xmlEncode(String s)
      Escape characters for text appearing as XML data, between tags.

      The following characters are replaced with corresponding character entities:

      Character Encoding
      < &lt;
      > &gt;
      & &amp;
      " &quot;
      ' &#039;
      Parameters:
      s - String to encode. Non-null.
      Returns:
      XML encoded version of s. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If s is null.

    • writeToFile

      public static void writeToFile(Document document, File file) throws IOException
      Write the specified XML document to the given file.
      Parameters:
      document - Document to write. Non-null.
      file - File to write to. Non-null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If document or file is null.
      IOException - If the write operation fails for some reason.

    • newDocument

      public static Document newDocument()
      Create a new empty XML document.
      Returns:
      Created document. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If parser is not configured right.

    • newDocument

      public static Document newDocument(String xml) throws SAXException
      Create an XML document from the specified XML string.
      Parameters:
      xml - XML string to create document from. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The requested document. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If xml is null.
      SAXException - If the string is not a proper XML document.

    • newDocument

      public static Document newDocument(File file) throws IOException, SAXException
      Create an XML document from the specified file.
      Parameters:
      file - File to create document from. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The requested document. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If file is null.
      IOException - If the file cannot be accessed for some reason.
      SAXException - If the file doesn't contain a proper XML document.

    • newDocument

      public static Document newDocument(InputStream inputStream) throws IOException, SAXException
      Create an XML document from the specified input stream.
      Parameters:
      inputStream - Input stream to create document from. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The requested document. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If inputStream is null.
      IOException - If the input stream cannot be accessed for some reason.
      SAXException - If the input stream doesn't contain a proper XML document.

    • isWellFormed

      public static boolean isWellFormed(String xml)
      Check if the specified XML is well-formed.
      Parameters:
      xml - XML to check. Non-null.
      Returns:
      True if the XML is well-formed, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If xml is null.

    • prettyPrint

      public static String prettyPrint(String xml)
      Pretty print the specified XML string.
      Parameters:
      xml - XML string to pretty print. Non-null.
      Returns:
      A pretty printed version of the input, or the string itself if it doesn't form a well-formed XML.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If xml is null.

    • prettyPrint

      public static String prettyPrint(Node node)
      Pretty print the specified XML sub tree.
      Parameters:
      node - Root of sub tree to pretty print. Typically a document or an element.
      Returns:
      A pretty printed version of the input.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If node is null.

    • addElement

      public static Element addElement(Document document, String elementName)
      Add an element to the root of the specified document. A document can only have one root, so if there is a root already this is first removed.
      Parameters:
      document - Document to add root to. Non-null.
      elementName - Name of element to add. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The element added. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If document or elementName is null.

    • addElement

      public static void addElement(Element parentElement, Element element)
      Add the specified element to the end of the list of children of the given parent element,
      Parameters:
      parentElement - Element to add to. Non-null.
      element - Element to add. Non-null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If parentElement or element is null.

    • addElement

      public static Element addElement(Element parentElement, String elementName, Object elementValue)
      Add an element with text content to the specified parent element.
      Parameters:
      parentElement - Parent element to add to. Non-null.
      elementName - Name of element to add. Non-null.
      elementValue - Value of the added element. Null if empty.
      Returns:
      The added element. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If parentElement or elementName is null.

    • addElement

      public static Element addElement(Element parentElement, String elementName, Color color)
      Add a color element to the specified parent element.
      Parameters:
      parentElement - Parent element to add to. Non-null.
      elementName - Name of element to add. Non-null.
      color - Color to add. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The added element. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If parentElement, elementName or color is null.

    • addElement

      public static Element addElement(Element parentElement, String elementName)
      Add an empty element to the specified parent element.
      Parameters:
      parentElement - Parent element to add to. Non-null.
      elementName - Name of element to add. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The added element. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If parentElement or elementName is null.

    • insertElement

      public static void insertElement(Element parentElement, Element element, int index)
      Insert an element as child of the specified parent element and in the given index position.
      Parameters:
      parentElement - Element to add to. Non-null.
      element - Element to insert. Non-null.
      index - Insertion index. 0 as first. If index is larger than the current number of elements, it is added last. [0,>.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If parentElement or element is null, or if index < 0.

    • removeElement

      public static void removeElement(Element element)
      Remove the specified element from its parent.
      Parameters:
      element - Element to remove. Non-null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element is null.

    • removeChildren

      public static void removeChildren(Element element)
      Remove all children form the specified element.
      Parameters:
      element - Element to remove from. Non-null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element is null.

    • getChild

      public static Element getChild(Element element, String childName)
      Return a specified child element from the given element. Only intermediate children are considered.
      Parameters:
      element - Element to search. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child element to find. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The requested child element. If there are more than one child elements with the same name, the first one encountered is returned. Null if not found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

    • findChild

      public static Element findChild(Element element, String childName)
      Return a specific child element from the given element. Search full depth, return the first one encountered.
      Parameters:
      element - Root element of the search. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child element to find. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The requested child element. Null if not found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

    • findLastChild

      public static Element findLastChild(Element element, String childName)
      Return a specific child element from the given element. Search full depth, return the last one encountered.
      Parameters:
      element - Root element of the search. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child element to find. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The requested child element. Null if not found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

    • indexOf

      public static int indexOf(Element element, Element childElement)
      Return the index of the specified child element in the given element.
      Parameters:
      element - Parent element. Non-null.
      childElement - Child element to get index of. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The requested index, or -1 if childElement is not child of element.

    • findChildren

      public static List<Element> findChildren(Element element, String childName)

      element - Element to search. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child elements to find. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The requested child elements. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

      Parameters:
      element - Root element to find children of. Non-null.
      Returns:
      All children elements. Never null

      public static String getValue(Element element, String defaultValue)
      Return the value of the specified element.
      Parameters:
      element - Element to get content from. Non-null.
      defaultValue - Default value to return if content is absent. May be null.
      Returns:
      The requested content. May be null if defaultValue is null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element is null.

      Throws:

    • getChildValue

      public static String getChildValue(Element element, String childName, String defaultValue)
      Return the text content of the child of the specified element.
      Parameters:
      element - Parent element of child. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child element to get text content of. Non-null.
      defaultValue - Value to return if the child element is not found. May be null.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or the default value if not found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

    • getChildValue

      public static String getChildValue(Element element, String childName)
      Return the text content of the child of the specified element.
      Parameters:
      element - Parent element of child. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child element to get text content of. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or null if element not found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

    • getChildValue

      public static Double getChildValue(Element element, String childName, Double defaultValue)
      Return the text content of the child of the specified element as a double.
      Parameters:
      element - Parent element of child. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child element to get text content of. Non-null.
      defaultValue - Value to return if the child element is not found or not of floating point format. May be null.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or the default value if not found or not of floating point format.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

    • getChildValue

      public static Integer getChildValue(Element element, String childName, Integer defaultValue)
      Return the text content of the child of the specified element as an integer.
      Parameters:
      element - Parent element of child. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child element to get text content of. Non-null.
      defaultValue - Value to return if the child element is not found or not of integral format. May be null.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or the default value if not found or not of integral format.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

    • getChildValue

      public static Long getChildValue(Element element, String childName, Long defaultValue)
      Return the text content of the child of the specified element as a long.
      Parameters:
      element - Parent element of child. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child element to get text content of. Non-null.
      defaultValue - Value to return if the child element is not found or not of integral format. May be null.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or the default value if not found or not of integral format.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

    • getChildValue

      public static Date getChildValue(Element element, String childName, Date defaultValue)
      Return the text content of the child of the specified element as an ISO 8601 date.
      Parameters:
      element - Parent element of child. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child element to get text content of. Non-null.
      defaultValue - Value to return if the child element is not found or not of date format. May be null.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or the default value if not found or not of date format.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

    • getChildValue

      public static String getChildValue(Element element, String childName, Object defaultValue)
      Return the text content of the child of the specified element as a string.
      Parameters:
      element - Parent element of child. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child element to get content of. Non-null.
      defaultValue - Value to return if the child element is not found or is not of correct type. May be null.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or the default value if not found or not of correct value.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

    • getChildValue

      public static Boolean getChildValue(Element element, String childName, Boolean defaultValue)
      Return the text content of the child of the specified element as a boolean.
      Parameters:
      element - Parent element of child. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child element to get text content of. Non-null.
      defaultValue - Value to return if the child element is not found.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or the default value if not found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

    • getChildValue

      public static Color getChildValue(Element element, String childName, Color defaultValue)
      Return the text content of the child of the specified element as a color. The element is assumed to have the following format: "r,g,b[,a]" where r, g, b, and a are [0,255].
      Parameters:
      element - Parent element of child. Non-null.
      childName - Name of child element to get text content of. Non-null.
      defaultValue - Value to return if the child element is not found or not of the expected format. May be null.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or the default value if not found or not of the expected format.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or childName is null.

    • addAttribute

      public static void addAttribute(Element element, String attributeName, Object value)
      Add the specified attribute to the given element. If the attribute already exists, its value is updated.
      Parameters:
      element - Element of attribute to set. Non-null.
      attributeName - Name of attribute to set. Non-null.
      value - Value to set. May be null, in case an empty string is set.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or attributeName is null.

    • setAttribute

      public static void setAttribute(Element element, String attributeName, Object value)
      Set value of the specified attribute. If the element does not have the specified attribute, this method has no effect, i.e. the attribute is not created in this case.
      Parameters:
      element - Element of attribute to set. Non-null.
      attributeName - Name of attribute to set. Non-null.
      value - Value to set. May be null, in case an empty string is set.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or attributeName is null.

    • getAttribute

      public static String getAttribute(Element element, String attributeName, String defaultValue)
      Return the attribute of a specified element as a string.
      Parameters:
      element - Element to find attribute of. Non-null.
      attributeName - Name of attribute to get value of.
      defaultValue - Default value to report if attribute is not found.
      Returns:
      The requested value or defaultValue if not found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or attributeName is null.

    • getAttribute

      public static String getAttribute(Element element, String attributeName)
      Return the attribute of a specified element as a string.
      Parameters:
      element - Element to find attribute of. Non-null.
      attributeName - Name of attribute to get value of.
      Returns:
      The requested value or null if the element or attribute is not found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or attributeName is null.

    • getAttribute

      public static Integer getAttribute(Element element, String attributeName, Integer defaultValue)
      Return the attribute of a specified element as an integer.
      Parameters:
      element - Element to find attribute of. Non-null.
      attributeName - Name of attribute to get value of.
      defaultValue - Default value to report if attribute is not found or not convertible to an integer. May be null.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or defaultValue if not found or not an integer.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or attributeName is null.

      defaultValue - Default value to report if attribute is not found.

      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or attributeName is null.

    • getAttribute

      public static Color getAttribute(Element element, String attributeName, Color defaultValue)
      Return the attribute of a specific element as a color. Expected format: <element color="r,g,b,a">. a is optional.
      Parameters:
      element - Element to find attribute of. Non-null.
      attributeName - Name of attribute to get value of.
      defaultValue - Default value to report if attribute is not found or not convertible to an integer. May be null.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or defaultValue if not found or not in correct format.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If element or attributeName is null.

    • getChildAttribute

      public static String getChildAttribute(Element rootElement, String elementName, String attributeName, String defaultValue)
      Return the attribute of a specified child element as a string.
      Parameters:
      rootElement - Element to search from. Non-null. Non-null.
      elementName - Name of element to look for. Non-null.
      attributeName - Name of attribute to get value of. Non-null.
      defaultValue - Default value to report if attribute is not found.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or defaultValue if not found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If rootElement, elementName or attributeName is null.

    • getChildAttribute

      elementName - Name of element to look for. Non-null.
      attributeName - Name of attribute to get value of. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The requested value, or null if not found.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If rootElement, elementName or attributeName is null.

    • toString

      public static String toString(Node node)
      Transform an XML node (document or element typically) to its equivalent XML string.
      Parameters:
      node - Node to get as string. Non-null.
      Returns:
      The associated string. Never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If node is null.
